intro: Quoya hemigenoides, commonly known as the mountain quoya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Quoya hemigenoides is often found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat.
